question: Seven million Euros.
answer: I expect a guarantee that I have consent within six months and no red tape.

question: That's right Uri, you can consider that done.
answer: Drink! Follow me.

question: Oh, that's a nice picture Uri, hasn't it got, errrh depth?
answer: That picture has brought me nothing but luck Lenny,..it's my lucky picture. You like? Take it for a while, maybe it will give you luck.

question: Oh I couldn't Uri,...
answer: Now we're partners, I insist. I will get it sent around to your house and you can give it back to me when our deal is finalized.

question: What's happening?
answer: You know the lady, the posh one who likes abitta the rough life?

question: The accountant, what about her? You haven't heard from her in a while, too dangerous that one.
answer: Says she's got some work, you know,... proper work. I would normally turn her down, but considering,...

question: Let's have a meet.
answer: I got one like that at home with a little boy fishing.

question: There are two accountants taking out seven million Euros from a bank I know and it won't be protected. Twenty percent for me, as normal. The details are in here.
answer: Anything else?

question: Yes,..I don't want this coming back to me so, if you could give them a black eye,..that might help. She see's a slight pause and look of concern from One Two. A black eye, nothing more.
answer: Ok, very good Mrs. Dexter, a black eye it is then. Nice shoes.

question: Very good councilor, you must of had lessons as a boy. Fancy a cool down and a chat with Lenny? Do you know Jackie?
answer: No, no, no, Archy, don't say anything.

question: Don't worry, she's a friend,..and a member. Jackie,..fancy a run'a'round with the Councilor?
answer: What does she mean by that?

question: Errh, I think they are probably right, times have changed, but that shouldn't affect you Lenny.
answer: They say it's all gone "international" now, out with the old guard in with the new, but I think they're wrong. Anyway, where are my manners? Look at you sweaty as a native and pink as a pelican,...and I haven't even offered you a wet one.

question: A lemonade and orange please.
answer: Oh that's nice,..refreshing, that'll put you back on top boy. Here you go, plans and papers. Would you like a cigar?

question: I don't mind if I do,...that's a nice lighter.
answer: Eight grand they wanted for it cheeky toads and I paid, you know why?

question: Tell me Lenny.
answer: 'Cos it's all about the details.

question: Danny slap him. With the right Danny,..properly. I said properly, with the back of your right hand Danny. Slap him! Like that!
answer: PINK Revision - 6-20-07 20A.

question: Now, if you men can master a slap like that, there's no need for your clients to hold back. They'll open up like a fountain full of words after one of those.
answer: PINK Revision - 6-19-07 21.

question: Oi, come back here. Where's reverse? Right, now fuck off.
answer: Slowly and keep smiling.

question: Shit,...
answer: What?

question: I have got to hurt him. Oi come back here.
answer: Why? What did he ever do to you? Come on we've got the money now let's piss off!

question: You're an embarrassment to crime you are.
answer: She asked me to give him a black eye.

question: She's sick that bird of yours, sick. Quickly changing the subject.
answer: Is Handsome Bob behind?

question: I know a man that'll copy that for you. Might take him a couple of minutes mind.
answer: You don't need to copy anything any more, welcome to the nouveau riche Mr. One Two.

question: Here's one for you too Mrs Dexter.
answer: Why thank you Mr. One Two. I see you didn't think much of the black eye though.

question: Would have liked to obliged, but from a professional point of view, it just wasn't natural,... Until next time then.
answer: Until next time.

question: What, all of it?
answer: Yeah, all of it.

question: Where did they get that from then?
answer: Ask no questions hear no lies. Just gotta do is find your painting now Len.

question: You know, I like you. I like the way you...are. Always thinking about business, very professional.
answer: That's what you pay me to be, isn't it?

question: Tell me about your husband.
answer: My husband is a lawyer.

question: I hear he is very good at what he does, maybe we can have some work for him. Tell me, what do you do for fun? Have I offended you in some way?
answer: I don't quite know where this is going and if you don't mind, I would like to keep our relationship professional.

question: But that's tomorrow night, tonight its take off time, we've prepared a little going away party. I got "the Harris twins" the most expensive escort girls to have ever escorted.
answer: PINK Revision - 6-20-07 34A.

question: They've got a night off from the Russians and they've all been greased down just for the Bobski! It's going to take you two and a half years just to recover from this little party.
answer: WHITE Revision - 6-6-07 35.

question: That cheered you up then?
answer: It's not that I am ungrateful One Two, it's just,....

question: It's just what?
answer: Don't worry,..you wouldn't understand.

question: I understand anything coming from you Bobby boy.
answer: Would you?

question: You're me best mate.
answer: I don't want the strippers One Two,.... I want you,....

question: You dirty bastard! I know all your girlfriends all of 'em!
answer: See, I told you you wouldn't understand!

question: That didn't work did it? How can a dead man sell you a painting? Put 'em back Arch, before I shoot 'em.

question: Don't you dare call him my boy.

question: He won't die that cockroach.

question: That junkie's seen more funerals than a fuckin undertaker,.. that boy is poison.
answer: WHITE Revision - 6-6-07 38.

question: Just couldn't, it's got me,...that's what art does Pete, it gets you.

question: You wouldn't understand.
answer: Why not?

question: Because,.....You,.... Are street scum Pete. You're in need of an education, that's what you need, but your Dad never gave a shit about you did he? And that is why you are on the gear. Your gear is your surrogate father.
answer: Leave off John, what is this shrink time?

question: Come on Pedro, share. I'm your sponsor, Doctor,...your dad if you're feeling a bit of regression coming on. But first we should have a drink in our hands.

question: You think? It wasn't all bad, he sometimes made me laugh too.
answer: Now we're getting somewhere. Did he interfere with you? You know, touch you inappropriate like?

question: He tickled me if that's what you mean.
answer: Now that's it! That's what I was looking for, you see your Dad is a monster Pedro, a tickling monster. Pedro's dad's a tickling monster!

question: Fuck you singalong, you're no help and stop calling me Pedro.
answer: Come on boy, I'll have you and ya girlfriends! I'll do the lot of yazz.

question: Come on boy, I'll have you and ya girlfriends! I'll do the lot of yazz.
answer: PINK Revision - 6-20-07 40A.

question: Was I good or what Pete? It's all in the eyes.
answer: PINK Revision - 6-19-07 41.

question: Junkies, I'll shit 'em! Did your Dad do anything else to you Pete?
answer: He hit me bad as well the slag. Hit with a chain.

question: What are you doing? I'm not going to tickle you Pete, I'm not your Dad. I find that profoundly offensive Pedro. Two's up on a snout to show I care.
answer: I used to think it had something to do with Bonanza.

question: Your dad was jealous. Cos you dad isn't sure he's your dad, cos you don't look like him.
answer: Really? What do I look like then?

question: Sorry to intrude. They call this a lichee don't they?
answer: I believe so.

question: Tasty exotic, bit like your suit.
answer: How can we help?

question: Don't you have an act called Story Time?
answer: We did.

question: And isn't there a lead singer called Johnny Story?
answer: There was.

question: Well, I would like to see Mr Johnny Story.
answer: I would like to see him too, but that might be tricky 'cos according to the newspapers the only songs Mr Story is going to be singing is hymns.

question: How did you get this number?
answer: I can get any number, I work with numbers don't I?

question: One point for initiative, two to tell me what's on your mind.
answer: I need a favor. My husbands having a party tonight and they need some "smarties" but they have nowhere to go. Look, I know it's a liberty, but I thought you might know people. Plus, I have another bit of work for you. You can bring your friends. There will be interesting people - the rich and famous, the great and good.

question: Well thank you Uri, that's a real compliment from a man that obviously takes good care of himself.
answer: I suppose you're wondering why you are here?

question: I assume you want to check that everything is still "kosher" at my end. I was a little surprised you didn't come through at the appropriate time, but I reckon you have your reasons. Silence.
answer: I assume everything is still as you say,...Kosher?

question: Don't you worry Uri, that one's on me,...partners and all that, but I wouldn't like it to go south again, makes things difficult, if you know what I mean?
answer: I understand Lenny and I wouldn't like things to go wrong either. Which brings me conveniently to my next point. Ever since the painting, my lucky painting, hasn't been hanging on my wall, things have not been,....so lucky. I know this is a rude request because we have not concluded our business, but I feel as though I need it.

question: Shut up Arch!
answer: Everything all right?

question: No it's fuckin not all right, he want's his painting, his lucky painting.
answer: Oh, I see. That's a bit of a problem then isn't it?

question: You should have seen his eyes I swore they changed color, went fuckin red they did.
answer: They don't care who's soil they are on that lot. They can buy half the country without breaking a sweat, you're small time to them. They could click their fingers and we'd be ether.

question: You speak to me like that again and I'll cut your fuckin tongue out. I run this town, got that, me! Anybody who thinks he's rude enough, let 'em raise a finger, 'cos I'll take off his whole fuckin arm. Do you understand that Archy? I said do YOU?
answer: Yes, I do Len.

question: Who are you?
answer: My name is Cookie.

question: You must be with Stella?
answer: No, we're with the Grand Old Duke of York.

question: Well you can't come in here, not without shaking my hand. So you're supposed to be a hard case eh?
answer: This is gonna be a scream, Fred get 'em in.

question: And that's why they call him One Two.
answer: So you're part of the wild bunch? Stella says you're dangerous.

question: Does she now?
answer: So is your friend part of the wild bunch?

question: That young man is the greatest gun slinger in town.
answer: Then how come I don't know him? I know all about your type.

question: How is that then?
answer: I'm a criminal lawyer,..and I know a secret about your part of town.

question: What secrets that then?
answer: You have an informer in your neck of the woods.

question: Oh yeah, so what's his name?
answer: You have to pay for secrets.

question: Drink?
answer: Large one,...Dance?

question: So, you're a dancer?
answer: Am I a dancer? Shall we put the record straight? You see it's all in the genes. My Dad was a dancer and his Dad before that so gradually it's percolated the old DNA. You not joining me?

question: Hello, I can sense a little competition. So what you got for me?
answer: The same job's back on again.

question: Oh yea? Don't throw my rhythm.
answer: Same time, same place, same money.

question: What about security?
answer: Same as before, but they're not my accountants. A couple of their's,..other than that, should be just the same.

question: Handsome, I got a job for you. See that man on the couch.
answer: The one that's staring at us? How can I miss him.

question: Do me a favor, chat him up.
answer: Fuck off what do think I am?

question: So, I hear you have a secret, but you look like you might have more than one. Why don't you confess?
answer: I don't want to talk about work.

question: If you tell me who the informer is, we will talk about whatever you want to, anyway, you don't have to tell me anything. If he's an informer you'll have his depositions and poems.
answer: My, my not just a pretty face. How do you know about those sort of things?

question: Pedro? Come back here. Where do you think you are going with that painting?
answer: You never said it was your Dad's or whatever you wanna call him. You gotta give it back John people are looking for it, bad people. The streets are alive with the sound of pain.

question: You may have a point Pete, but I can't give it up. You know why?
answer: No, why?

question: We'll use rock salt in the shot gun cartridges. Slip 'em into the revolver, if it starts getting large, we'll bang a couple in to 'em and that'll slow 'em down. They won't know the difference between lead or salt and of course Bob's driving.
answer: I don't want to use Bob.

question: What? He's our driver, the A-teams not complete without the driver. What's happened between you and Bob?
answer: I think there might be something about Bob you don't know Mumbles.

question: What's that then? That he's a poof?
answer: What? Eh? How did you know?

question: Everybody knows he's a flamer, you're the only one who doesn't. He loves the boys.
answer: What are you talking about, I am losing orientation here Mumbles.

question: Did he make a pass at you, is this what this is all about?
answer: Yes, he fuckin did.

question: Hold on a minute, you won't tell the chaps what?
answer: What did you do? Suck his,...

question: Stop right fuckin there! What is going on here? Does that mean you've sucked his,...

question: Hold on! I am not fucking gay! He wanted a dance that's all!

question: A DANCE, yes, I did.
answer: Was it a slow dance?

question: What has he done to me?
answer: I think there's something else you should know about our Bob.

question: What, there's more?
answer: Who do you think looked after your Mum before she died, whilst you were doing a two stretch?

question: Who do you think looked after your Mum before she died, whilst you were doing a two stretch?
answer: PINK Revision - 6-19-07 57.

question: 'Cos it wasn't fuckin me and I am your best pal!
answer: PINK Revision - 6-19-07 58.

question: Joke to be inserted by Cookie. Hello, it's Roman and Mickey, what are you doing here boys?

question: Well, you should be the first to know this, but isn't he,...

question: Grab my hand, we're getting out of here.

question: I've got 'em.

question: I can't fuckin shoot him, you do it.

question: That is a rhetorical question I hope. A glass of water thank you. With a straw. Don't you want to know what happened?

question: You didn't say anything about guns,.. machine guns with war criminals stuck to the trigger.

question: What are you doing here Lenny? You can't come here.
answer: Steady, Councilor steady,...I go wherever I fuckin want. This is my town, not yours no matter what you and your pen pushing immigrant boy scouts might think. Now, what's going on?

question: Step in here. I can't do it, you've left it too long Lenny. You want something that the city has a ruling against, something they said they wouldn't give permission to build.
answer: Don't give me that shit. I can look out my window and there's twenty kinds of buildings this city said they'd never build, how did that happen eh? Fuckin termites got together and had a house building party did they? No sunshine, back handers put them up, back handers just like mine.

question: Pedro I swear this is the last time I'm having you take the piss, next time you're on your own.
answer: Sorry, I thought you might like some company.

question: I am dead Pete, what does that tell you? It tells you, that dead people don't like company! Now jog 'em on.
answer: All right, I'll tell 'em to leave.

question: Yes you fucking well will, smelly junkies. Meeting adjourned. Johnny and Pete walk out of the toilet, Malcolm and Paul are gone.
answer: You've scared 'em off sing-a-long, but with a welcome like that it's not all that shocking.

question: Paul, please exhibit to the audience the fine artifact. Now, now young Paul rest your weary legs. Gentlemen,...we are entering the realm of the ancient art form of paint on canvas,...
answer: I'll have it, how much?

question: One moment sir, there's a pitch that comes with this painting,....
answer: I don't want the pitch, I said I'll have it.

question: It's a very rare and expensive painting sir.
answer: Here ya go, have a week in snow.

question: I'll have that painting in a couple of days Uri, trust me on that.
answer: You like it out here Lenny?

question: Can't beat the great outdoors can you Uri? I can't understand it, not a soul out here.
answer: That's because I have had the course cleared for us Lenny, we are not going to be disturbed.

question: Oh that's good, I love a clear fair way, that's a bitta me that Uri. Nothing worse than being jogged on by blind tourists swinging a stick on a Sunday.
answer: What are we going to do Lenny? Every time I am about to make my payment something dishonest happens. You, wouldn't know anything about that, would you?

question: Excuse me? Are you trying to say something Uri?
answer: I am not trying Lenny, I am saying something.

question: I have to go now Lenny, I am having lunch with the Councilor, your Councilor. This, as you know, is the ninth hole and it is a long crawl back to your car. You should make it by sunrise, just in time to bring me my "lucky picture." I want it back do you hear me?

question: After that, I don't want to hear from you again, disappear do you understand me Lenny? Lenny?

question: What?

question: I ain't playing fuckin games here Arch look at me, who?

question: Hello Archy.

question: Give us your money boys. Archy grabs the gun and hits Johnny on the back of the head, not too hard.

question: You're looking a bit down, has that old clown been working you long hours? You always were loyal - no dog like a loyal dog.
